**Silver dragon scale mail**, or **SDSM**, is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Perks versus gray DSM](#Perks_versus_gray_DSM)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [5.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Silver dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") gray dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) - [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") have an effective 1⁄4 chance of forcing silver dragon scale mail in place of their initial body armor.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, silver dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing silver dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Silver dragon scale mail is one of the two most coveted types of dragon scale mail, with the other being [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail"). Reflection is a fairly rare property outside of [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") sources, naturally making it a good first [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for many characters and a popular item in [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") - it is usually combined with a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") and/or other non-body armor source of [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

In terms of advantages as a candidate for wishes or ascension kits, silver dragon scale mail keeps the amulet slot open for the [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") to be worn, and also keeps the [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") slot free for [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") or use of either a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") (which is [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")-friendly) or an [elven shield](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield") (which can generally reach the highest [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") among shields). Silver dragon mail also completely blocks damage to a character and their inventory from [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") produced by [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), some [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") and [breath weapons](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon"). While magic resistance is harder to obtain without wishing compared to reflection, though an early series of wishes (e.g. usually a lucky [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")) can remove this factor, leaving it more up to a player's desired character build and their character's capabilities.

### Perks versus gray DSM

- *Main article: [GDSM versus SDSM](/wiki/GDSM_versus_SDSM "GDSM versus SDSM")*

Characters that can twoweapon will lean towards silver dragon scale mail for its ability to keep the shield slot free, while [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") will almost always default to silver dragon mail due since they have early access to magic resistance. Reflection is also much harder to obtain via [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") wishing, compared to the plentiful artifact sources of magic resistance available for non-chaotic characters (though chaotic non-Wizards can still wish for Magicbane, if they are willing to deal with blasting damage). Characters in roles with a [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") that is likely to feature a high amount of wands and/or a nemesis with deadly breath attacks may tend towards silver dragon scale mail as well. If a particular build is not that concerned about [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") (e.g. they plan to kill monsters with dangerous melee attacks before they can strike), they may consider silver dragon mail to pair with a cloak of magic resistance.

Relying on body armor for reflection introduces some notable risks: a character that obtains silver dragon scale mail first with no sources of magic resistance is vulnerable to [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") - while a silver dragon is not a particularly bad form to be in, their mail will be reverted to scales at minimum, and the scales may be destroyed if they run into another polymorph trap in silver dragon form. Reflection protects a character from the [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"), but does ***not*** stop the [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death") spell, which means possible doom if they cannot obtain magic resistance before running into a high-level hostile spellcaster (or a [shapeshifter](/wiki/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") in the form of one). Additionally, while reflection can be obtained through a few non-dragon armor sources, the magic resistance source(s) for a character with SDSM will almost always have to include a cloak of magic resistance: this restricts their ability to improve magic cancellation, and the alternative of relying on an artifact source introduces the risk of a quest artifact being stolen by the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), prolonging encounters against him even if the cloak is worn as a backup.

Opting for silver dragon mail early can prevent accidents involving [floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"), though these can be mitigated with careful play. Monsters that attempt to use wands against you are also likely to be killed by the reflected rays - the wand of death in particular is a more "welcome" discovery to a character wearing SDSM, and the armor can also preserve wand charges for later use if the [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound") kills the attacking monster. Though the [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") is not blocked by reflection, its damage is not much of a threat against characters with decent HP, and worn silver dragon scale mail is enough AC on its own that the wand will often miss. Reflection is also a stellar aid against a [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")'s disintegration breath, which can then be further trivialized by eating the dragon's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin").

## History

Silver dragon scale mail first appears in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), and makes its vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Some variants also give silver dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make other colors of dragon mail more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnoll shamans](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman") have a 1⁄10 chance of generating with silver dragon scale mail.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") characters can use their [tinker](/wiki/Tinker "Tinker") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") to turn various cloaks into a cloak of magic resistance with enough time, food and patience, which may make silver dragon scale mail more favorable for them early on.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), silver dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a wand of wishing can create dragon scale mail directly.

Silver dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **reflecting dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn silver dragon scale mail does not confer any additional properties, but its reflection additionally affects dragon breath as in *NetHack*, which most sources of reflection in dNetHack cannot do. Dragon scale mail also weighs 150 aum.

The [Platinum Dragon Plate](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Platinum_Dragon_Plate "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") set of silver dragon scale mail that can be obtained from the [Platinum Dragon](/index.php?title=Platinum_Dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Platinum Dragon (page does not exist)") in his fortress, which has a 1⁄8 chance of appearing as the topmost floor of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Law_quest_\(dNetHack\) "Law quest (dNetHack)"). While worn, the Platinum Dragon Plate confers [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action"), [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), with all properties capable of affecting dragon breath like typical dragon armor. The Platinum Dragon Plate also weighs 225 aum, which is 3⁄2 the weight of normal dragon scale mail, and raises spellcasting failure rates like metal armor does; it can be [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") to revert them to dragon scales, which can be converted back into dragon scale mail or a dragon scale shield as usual while retaining their artifact status.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn silver dragon scale mail confers no additional properties, but provides reflection that affects dragonbreath and rays from wands [used at Skilled or higher](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"). It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Duri](/wiki/Duri "Duri") always generates with silver dragon scale mail.

Relying on body armor for reflection introduces some notable risks: a character that obtains silver dragon scale mail first with no sources of magic resistance is vulnerable to [[polymorph trap]]s - while a silver dragon is not a particularly bad form to be in, their mail will be reverted to scales at minimum, and the scales may be destroyed if they run into another polymorph trap in silver dragon form. Reflection protects a character from the [[wand of death]], but does '''''not''''' stop the [[touch of death]] spell, which means possible doom if they cannot obtain magic resistance before running into a high-level hostile spellcaster (or a [[shapeshifter]] in the form of one). Additionally, while reflection can be obtained through a few non-dragon armor sources, the magic resistance source(s) for a character with SDSM will almost always have to include a cloak of magic resistance: this restricts their ability to improve magic cancellation, and the alternative of relying on an artifact source introduces the risk of a quest artifact being stolen by the [[Wizard of Yendor]], prolonging encounters against him even if the cloak is worn as a backup. Opting for silver dragon mail early can prevent accidents involving [[floating eye]]s, though these can be mitigated with careful play. Monsters that attempt to use wands against you are also likely to be killed by the reflected rays - the wand of death in particular is a more "welcome" discovery to a character wearing SDSM, and the armor can also preserve wand charges for later use if the [[rebound]] kills the attacking monster. Though the [[wand of striking]] is not blocked by reflection, its damage is not much of a threat against characters with decent HP, and worn silver dragon scale mail is enough AC on its own that the wand will often miss. Reflection is also a stellar aid against a [[black dragon]]'s disintegration breath, which can then be further trivialized by eating the dragon's [[corpse]] or [[tin]]. ==History== Silver dragon scale mail first appears in [[SLASH 6]], and makes its vanilla debut in [[NetHack 3.3.0]]. ==Variants== {{main|Dragon-scaled armor}} In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [[cloak]], and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [[NetHack Fourk]], [[xNetHack]], [[EvilHack]], and [[Hack'EM]]. Some variants also give silver dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [[object properties]] may also make other colors of dragon mail more worthwhile. ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], [[gnoll shaman]]s have a {{frac|10}} chance of generating with silver dragon scale mail.{{refsrc|makemon.c|719|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} [[Gnome (starting race)|Gnomish]] characters can use their [[tinker]] [[technique]] to turn various cloaks into a cloak of magic resistance with enough time, food and patience, which may make silver dragon scale mail more favorable for them early on. ===SporkHack=== In [[SporkHack]], silver dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn. ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [[Randomized appearance|appearances]] in each game - to [[wish]] for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [[scroll of identify]] on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a wand of wishing can create dragon scale mail directly. Silver dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by '''reflecting dragon scale mail''', which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack. ===dNetHack=== {{main|Dragon armor (dNetHack)}} In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], worn silver dragon scale mail does not confer any additional properties, but its reflection additionally affects dragon breath as in ''NetHack'', which most sources of reflection in dNetHack cannot do. Dragon scale mail also weighs 150 aum. The [[dNetHack artifacts#Platinum Dragon Plate|Platinum Dragon Plate]] is an unaligned [[artifact]] set of silver dragon scale mail that can be obtained from the [[Platinum Dragon]] in his fortress, which has a {{frac|8}} chance of appearing as the topmost floor of the [[Law quest (dNetHack)|Lawful Quest]]. While worn, the Platinum Dragon Plate confers [[fire resistance]], [[cold resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[disintegration resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[free action]], [[magic resistance]], and [[reflection]], with all properties capable of affecting dragon breath like typical dragon armor. The Platinum Dragon Plate also weighs 225 aum, which is {{frac|3|2}} the weight of normal dragon scale mail, and raises spellcasting failure rates like metal armor does; it can be [[cancelled]] to revert them to dragon scales, which can be converted back into dragon scale mail or a dragon scale shield as usual while retaining their artifact status. ===FIQHack=== In [[FIQHack]], worn silver dragon scale mail confers no additional properties, but provides reflection that affects dragonbreath and rays from wands [[Wands Balance Patch|used at Skilled or higher]]. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn). ===SlashTHEM=== In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Duri]] always generates with silver dragon scale mail. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Dragon armor]]
